alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 10:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Clay. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy fell rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plank, Botto, Goose Rock, Lipps, Boho, Hector, Brightshade, Ice Cliff, Marcum, Creekville, Spring Creek, Lincoln and Garrard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
